content: LudWitt sums up best what’s so irritating about the latest wave of overblown startup claims: nowadays the claim/story/hype predates even the slightest trace of fact, and the bolder the claim the better.   The media happily push the fairy tale around until the difficulty of reality brutally sets in, at which point they happily push the scandal story around (that’s what the media do, believe it or not). The honeymoon period between the press and investors and founders is over, and the latter whine against the nasty press “ready to torpedo your business”. Oh what a cruel world !
